diseases.name: Rice Blast
diseases.description: A fungal disease caused by Magnaporthe oryzae, leading to spindle-shaped lesions on leaves, nodes, and panicles.
managementPractices: Use resistant varieties such as IR64.
Apply fungicides like tricyclazole or isoprothiolane.
Maintain proper field drainage to reduce humidity.
preventionMethods: Rotate crops to break the disease cycle.

diseases.name: Sheath Blight
diseases.description: A fungal disease caused by Rhizoctonia solani, resulting in irregular lesions on the leaf sheath and eventual lodging.
managementPractices: Improve spacing for better air circulation.
Apply fungicides like azoxystrobin or propiconazole.
Remove and burn infected plant residues.
preventionMethods: Use resistant rice varieties when available.

diseases.name: Bacterial Leaf Blight
diseases.description: A bacterial disease caused by Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae, creating yellow to white streaks on leaves.
managementPractices: Plant resistant varieties such as IR36.
Apply copper-based bactericides.
Ensure field sanitation by removing infected plants.

diseases.name: Rice Tungro Disease
diseases.description: A viral disease transmitted by green leafhoppers, leading to stunted growth and yellowish-orange leaf discoloration.
managementPractices: Plant resistant varieties like Matatag lines.
Control leafhoppers using insecticides.
Remove and destroy infected plants.

diseases.name: Brown Spot
diseases.description: Caused by the fungus Bipolaris oryzae, this disease produces brown spots on leaves, reducing photosynthesis.
managementPractices: Use balanced fertilizers to improve plant vigor.
Apply fungicides like mancozeb or carbendazim.
Improve water management practices.

diseases.name: Stem Rot
diseases.description: Caused by Sclerotium oryzae, this disease weakens the stem, leading to lodging and reduced grain yield.
managementPractices: Apply fungicides like propiconazole.
Improve field drainage to reduce waterlogging.
Incorporate crop residues to promote soil health.

diseases.name: False Smut
diseases.description: Caused by Ustilaginoidea virens, this disease creates yellowish to green balls on grains.
managementPractices: Apply fungicides during the flowering stage.
Remove infected panicles from the field.
Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilization.

diseases.name: Grain Discoloration
diseases.description: A fungal or bacterial infection causing discoloration of rice grains, often leading to poor grain quality.
managementPractices: Apply fungicides such as carbendazim.
Harvest at the right moisture level.
Dry grains properly before storage.
preventionMethods: Store grains in a dry environment.
